events.name: Soulful Saturday Hike and Yoga in the Oakland Hills!
events.description:
Please join us for some mindful hiking and yoga through the wooded trails of the Oakland Hills! This gentle hike is designed as an opportunity to integrate mindfulness, yoga and nature. Take some time to restore, set intentions, and connect with nature. The whole hike and yoga session will take approximately 2 hours.

We will be hiking parts of the Fern Ravine and Sequoia Bayview trails (both easy to moderate).

There will be parts of the hike where we honor the silence and engage deeply with ourselves and our natural surroundings.

The yoga portion will be led by the amazing yoga teacher, Satya de La Paz . All yoga levels are welcome. Donations to her would be graciously accepted.

Attire:
Please plan to wear comfortable shoes or hiking boots with ankle support. Since the weather can be unpredictable and we’re hiking in a wooded area, please plan to dress in layers and comfortable fitting clothes for the yoga.

RELEASE:

Please make sure you review a copy of the Outdoor Afro trip waiver so that we can start this activity on time http://www.outdoorafro.com/outdoor-afro-trip-waiver_2017002_waiver/ (http://www.outdoorafro.com/outdoor-afro-trip-waiver_2017002_waiver/)

Bring:
Water
Light Snack

Yoga Mat

Day pack-(that can hold yoga mat)

Parking and Meeting Spot:

We will meet in the Redwood Bowl Staging Area parking lot adjacent to the Chabot Space and Science Center as seen below at 2:30PM and will begin our hike at 2:45 PM

events.name: Night of Worship and Healing
events.description:
Night of Worship and Healing @ Crosswalk Community Church, Sunnyvale. The last event was very good. If you missed it, here is another chance to attend. All are welcome to enjoy this extended time of worship and prayer ministry.

Dave Clark will be leading worship. He is an awesome worship leader!!
Pastor David Alvarez (The Healing Path Ministry) will be teaching, and the Healing Path team will be ministering.

Wednesday, May 2nd at 6:30pm.
445 S. Mary Ave. Sunnyvale, 94086

Come!
Invite your family. Invite your friends.

events.name: Spring Potluck At Lake Merritt
events.description:
Hey Bay Area!!! Let's share in community and food at Oakland's Lake Merritt. In the style of an outdoor potluck, we will bring our blankets, chairs, and favorite recipes to share. This potluck will be a great opportunity to socialize with local Outdoor Afros and Outdoor Afro leaders.

Where we will meet:

We will meet on the lawn next to Lake Chalet restaurant.

Who this is for:

-This event is family friendly

-This event is wheelchair accessible

What you should bring:

-Dress for the weather: We are expecting some clouds, so wear layers.

-Please provide at least one shareable dish or non-alchoholic beverage.

-Bring your own dishes cups and silverware (i.e. Klean Kanteen)

-Bring chairs and blankets to sit on -Wear comfortable shoes and clothes for walking.

-Bring anything you may need to be comfortable and have fun. (sunglasses, guitar, discs, football, etc..)

*****WAIVER*****

Please review and be ready to sign a copy of the Outdoor Afro release waiver found here:
http://outdoorafro.com/waiver/
events.how_to_find_us: We will meet on the lawn next to Lake Chalet restaurant.

events.name: HOW TO GET What You Really Want: Venture Singles Right Relationships Series
events.description:
This new spring series runs from April 15th to May 6th... meeting each Sunday from 5:30 - 7:30 pm at Venue 2 @ Venture Christian Church on April 15th and 22nd, at Room 300 @ Venture Christian Church on April 29th, and May 6th: 16845 Hicks Road in Los Gatos.

Each week we will watch a video based on the featured topic; in community (both large group and small), we will discuss a series of thoughtful questions to encourage insightful conversations. We hope this series will lead to active changes and practical steps for growth. There will be no workbooks needed.

You may wish to join the series from the beginning (recommended) or feel free to pop in to any session along the way! Series continues April 22nd, April 29th and May 6th.

PART 2: Don’t Be Deceived

INTRODUCTION
We’ll never get what we really want until we discover what is most valuable. But choosing what’s
valuable doesn’t come naturally. We’ve all had the experience of getting what we naturally want, only to discover it’s not what is most valuable—it’s not what we ultimately want. But how do we avoid being deceived by our short-term desires?

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Bottled water will be provided. Feel free to bring your own snack/dinner.
Dinner fellowship afterward at a nearby IHOP (or another late night restaurant)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
ABOUT VENTURE SINGLES

WHO WE ARE: Community-oriented, Christ-centered, collaborative singles who gather weekly for great conversation and education about one of life’s greatest pursuits: loving, lasting relationships. Each week we will watch a video based on the featured topic; in a community (both large group, and small) we will discuss a series of thoughtful questions to encourage insightful conversations. We hope our time together will lead to active changes and practical steps for growth for all interested in better relationships. You may wish to join amidst an existing series or at the beginning of our next one.

OUR MISSION is to provide community and a place of solace to singles, whether single by chance, change, or choice.
OUR HOPE is to encourage singles to embrace God’s love and unique plan for their lives.
OUR DESIRE is to transform through growing in our relationship with God, and in friendship with each other.

TO LEARN MORE:
By visiting The Venture website: http://venture.cc/classes (bottom of page)
By joining Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/rightrelationships/
By emailing Mark Barber: [masked]
events.how_to_find_us: Meet in Venue 2 on April 15th, and 22nd;  Room 300 on April 29th, and May 6th.

events.name: Edgewood park hike -on the shorter side but sweet
events.description:
Details
Let's go hiking on the peninsula! We can hike 3.5 miles in this time frame....we can make it quicker to burn off calories, as there is some good uphill.
It may be a bit tricky to find parking on a Sat morning in May..so plan to come a bit early:)There is parking at this park, and if by chance the lot is full, there is a bit of parking by the road. Here is a link to the park with directions. There are bathrooms, and no dogs are allowed.https://parks.smcgov.org/edgewood-park-natural-preserve

events.name: Del Valle Family Camping: 1nighter for water sports, fishing, hiking and biking
Ride Like A Girl

group.name: Bicycle Trails Council of the East Bay

events.description:
The Bicycle Trails Council (BTC) hosts a mtn bike ride for women-only on the first Saturday of the month. The intent of the ride is to have fun! and to meet other women who love to mtn bike.

Ladies, we are in for a treat! Kelli has graciously volunteered to help lead a ride at the Augustine Bernal and Pleasanton Ridge Parks, via the Golden Eagle entrance. This entrance starts at a higher elevation than the standard Pleasanton Ridge ride and starts us off on a trail which is mostly shaded. This means less climbing and much more shade than the standard route! Yay! The Golden Eagle entrance is in a gated residential area so it is awesome that Kelli can get us in! So, you must TELL THE GATE ATTENDANT that YOU ARE WITH KELLI's RIDE.

The hills are brilliantly green right now and wildflowers are blooming meaning a beautiful scenic ride is in store. The route has an initial 1.9 mile climb, and is about 10 miles in length with 1600’ of climbing. It is about 75% singletrack – yay! Plan on a 2-3 hour ride. Though there is less climbing than the standard route, there still will be climbing, with a few semi-steep sections. This ride is best for riders who have some aerobic and climbing ability. The route is a little technical in places including a few switchbacks. This is not a novice ride but its not super advanced either. Afterwards we’ll hang out for refreshments and socializing. If you have questions on whether this ride is right for you, please email Amy at: [masked]

What to bring: a mtn bike in good working condition, and water and snacks for the trail.

When: Sat 5/5/2018. Meet at 9:15 am to sign in, unload bikes, and meet other riders. We will roll at 9:30.

Carpool: If possible please carpool since parking may be somewhat limited.

Where: The Golden Eagle entrance address is: 8200 Golden Eagle Way, Pleasanton.

How to enter: AT THE GATE TELL THE ATTENDANT that YOU ARE WITH “KELLI'S RIDE”.

Headcount: Please RSVP if you are quite certain you will attend, but cancel your RSVP by Friday 8 pm if you cannot make it. This way we can let the entrance attendant know how many riders to expect. If something comes up the morning of the ride please call Kelli at[masked].

Rain cancels. If you RSVP on Meetup, you will receive an email by noon the day before the ride if the ride is cancelled or if there is any change to the ride.

Looking forward to seeing you!

If you have questions, please Meetup-message Amy.

events.name: Beginner Ride! Fremont Older After Work Ride
events.description:
Beginner level ride!

Due to popular demand I'll be making the trek up from Morgan Hill to host some beginner level rides at Fremont Older this season.

This will be a mellow paced ride, great for newer riders just getting their feet wet in the sport. We'll meet up at the lot and ride up from there towards maises peak. The initial climb can be challenging for newer riders but we'll have a sweep to make sure no one gets left behind. We'll all meetup at the top of Maises for a group photo before heading back towards the toyon trails. If we have faster riders that want extra credit, there will be an option to do all three toyon trails. The rest of us will head down toyon 2 and 1 before heading towards the beginning of seven springs trail.

The total ride is about 7 miles and under 1000ft of elevation gain. If you are new to the sport and have any questions please feel free to message or email me. I'm always happy to help and offer any experience new riders.

Get out, go ride!
-David
events.how_to_find_us: Meet in the parking lot at the end of Prospect rd.

events.name: Trail Head Cyclery Demo Day at Santa Teresa
events.description:
• What we'll do
https://trailheadcyclery.com/event/trail-head-cyclery-dirt-demo/

Demo day at Santa Teresa. Show up early to grab the bike you really want to try. I will be there one of the days and ride up & down Rocky Ridge as many times as I can with different demo bikes. The demo bikes are not beginner oriented bikes, but it's a great opportunity for intermediate/advanced riders looking to upgrade. Bike fleets are not announced, but probably similar to their demo fleet:
https://trailheadcyclery.com/demo-program/demo-rental-program/

• What to bring

• Important to know

events.name: Cinco de Mayo Themed Food Fellowship Nite!
events.description:
Come join la fiesta! We're hosting a Cinco de Mayo themed Fellowship night. We'll eat tasty Mexican food, play a couple of games, do the Hat dance, and listen to some Mariachi music. And don't forget the Piñata!

Ai Yai Yai Yai! Put on your sombreros and come ready to celebrate our May birthday people. There is no cost for the meal, but we do ask for donations to offset the cost of the food. Bring your amigos! Feel free to forward this information to other Christian singles who enjoy fiestas.

In order to make sure we have enough food, we require everyone to RSVP. If you're bringing a friend please note that in your response.

For further information about ALCF Singles Ministry and upcoming events, please visit our website at: http://www.alcf.net/singles

Looking forward to meeting you!

The ALCF Singles Leadership Team

events.name: Oakland Rose Garden to Piedmont Mansions, Gardens and Views | 6 cardio miles!
events.description:
Annual Spring Treat!

We'll meet at the Morcom Amphitheater of Roses to begin our tour of blooming roses, the mansions of Piedmont, lush gardens, views and a good uphill cardio workout.

We'll take 15 minutes to preview the Florentine style garden before the walk, but you can explore the Rose Garden more in depth afterwards, to allow enough time for the walk. Perhaps, bring a picnic lunch.

This will be a somewhat challenging hike, so be ready with plenty of water and snacks. We'll have a mid-way snack/restroom break at about mile 1 and 4.

Annual Meetup Fee: 10.00 to help support my Meetup Dues and planning. Thank you.

Rain/drizzle cancels and we will reschedule.
events.how_to_find_us: Gathered by the columns.  Parking is free and plentiful across Grand in the neighborhood.  Areas served by AC Transit 12 and 33 from 19th BART.  Check in with me.  Use restroom in garden, if closed there is a Safeway nearby.

events.name: Club Meeting at La Paloma Mexican Restaurant
events.description:
Our general meetings are at La Paloma in Santa Clara, on El Camino Real between San Tomas and Scott Blvd.

Come join us for our monthly club meeting where we discuss the latest club activities, find out about amazing US and international ski and travel trips, share ski/snowboard racing results (winter time), swap stories, and whatever other shinanagins to conduct.

Meet at the bar for social hour from 6:30 - 7:30 followed by the club meeting at 7:30. It's a great time to connect with everyone. So come on out and bring a friend.

See you there!

Your Social Director
Kristi Williams
events.how_to_find_us: Find us at the bar until 7:00~7:30 pm.  We'll have dinner and hold the meeting in the side room.

group.name: East Bay Young  Professional Social Group

events.name: Dinner & Movie Night @ Dani’s in Dublin
BTCEB May 12 Gala Ride at Del Valle EBRP

group.name: Bicycle Trails Council of the East Bay

events.description:
• What we'll do
The Bicycle Trails Council of the East Bay (http://www.btceb.org) invites you to our monthly Gala Ride. We usually meet on the 2nd Saturday of every month.
This month we will at riding at Lake Del Valle EBRP. The setting is stunning, almost like being in the Lake country in Italy (really!). While Del Valle has some really steep fire roads, more and more single track is being opened up. WE NEED RIDE LEADERS! Jeff B, Mike P and Jane M, can we count on you again?

We offer ride groups for ALL SKILL LEVELS, from novice to intermediate to advanced. All rides are ‘no-drop’ rides (we won’t leave you behind or let you get lost) and are fully supported. A novice rider should be able to ride 10-12 miles on hilly fire roads for 2.5 hrs.

Rides are free and open to the public and led by experienced local mountain bikers familiar with the trails. Medical coverage is provided to all paid BTCEB members, one more reason to join. So go to our web site, http://www.bicycletrailscouncil.org/ and hit the JOIN TODAY button. We take PayPal.

We start gathering at 9:30am and hit the trails promptly at 9:45am. Join us for refreshments and snacks after the ride. Safety glasses are suggested. A well-tuned mountain bike is a must!

• What to bring: Water and sunscreen

• Important to know
events.how_to_find_us: We will gather at the East Swim Beach Parking lot.

events.name: FREE!  Swing Party & Potluck (Newark/Fremont)
events.description:
A FREE Swing Dance Party, with both a Free Beginners East Coast Swing and an Intermediate/Advanced Lindy Hop Lesson beforehand...on an (approximately) 800 square foot wood dance floor...in nearby Newark, targeted for Tri-City Fremont, Newark and Union City (as well as nearby East and Southbay) dance and vintage lifestyle enthusiasts?

Slim Fitness, located at 5437 Central Ave #3, Newark, CA 94560 is having a public Grand Opening Potluck Party, and they are very enthusiastic about the possibility of having a regular vintage swing dance/Lindy Hop event and possible class series.

They are especially looking to use either Friday or Saturday nights for regular swing dancing, so they have generously offered to allow us to host a swing dance party:

- Beginner East Coast Swing lesson at 6:30 p.m
- Intermediate/advanced Lindy Hop lesson at 7:00 p.m.
- Open dancing from 7:30 p.m - 10:00 p.m ....or until folks leave!

And for this one, the "cost of admission" is...nothing. (This first one will be FREE, but if there is enough interest to make this a regular monthly or bi-monthly event, or a weekly class series with open dancing after, we will, of course, charge a reasonable fee to cover costs for future ones, after this one.)

Non-stop Jump Rhythm and Blues, Do-Wop, Boogie Woogie, and traditional '50's Rockabilly from yours truly's personal collection, and this Family-Friendly event is officially a potluck, so if you feel like bringing something edible or drinkable to share, please do (but if you forget, we won't hold it against you.)

events.name: Sailing & Potluck (plant based) on the S.F. Bay

group.name: Bay Area Veg Friendly Activity Group (20s and 30s)

events.description:
We're going sailing on the Bay, and you’re invited to join us!

We’ll be departing from Oakland Marina (where there is free parking). We'll sail through the Oakland Estuary, alongside the Embarcadero Cove, Jack London Square, and the port of Oakland, while enjoying the Estuary's colorful waterfront area.

From there, we'll sail under the Bay Bridge, towards San Francisco and the Golden Gate Bridge. We’ll find a quite place to anchor either alongside Angel Island or Aquatic Cove Park in San Fransisco where we will have an amazing Plant Based potluck lunch on board the boat. After lunch, we'll sail a bit more and then sail towards and under the Golden Gate bridge, and then back to Oakland Marina.

Since we have very limited space, please join the Wait-List and private message us your name, phone number and a good time to call you. We'll then reply with instructions to complete your reservation.

This event is published on multiple Meetups, so please don't let a seemingly low or no RSVP count mislead you in terms of the remaining available spots for this event.

Thanks and we're looking forward to seeing you soon,
Steve & Lin

Steve is a US Coast Guard Licensed Master. He has been sailing since age 10 (~40 years ago). Steve is also a commercial, Multi Engine, IFR rated pilot and used to teach flying (IFR/MEI).
